item.title: What is Plinx ?
item.description: Plinx is my personal Postinstall Script to configure my whole Desktop. It is an acronym and it stands for Post Linuxinstall Script(+x for executible) With Plinx I want to automate my Linux configuration so that when ever I want to switch my Distro, I just have to run this script and it does everthing for me. Install git clone https://github.com/floork/plinx cd ./plinx ./install Features Copy configs install Programs Content Flatpaks com.

item.title: Linux Mouse speed
item.description: This is just a simple script to change the scrolling wheel speed To use it you just have to run: for Arch sudo pacman -S --noconfirm --needed imwheel zenity && curl -s -L https://raw.githubusercontent.com/floork/mouse-speed/main/speed.sh | bash for Fedora sudo dnf -y imwheel zenity && curl -s -L https://raw.githubusercontent.com/floork/mouse-speed/main/speed.sh | bash for Debian / Ubuntu sudo apt -y install imwheel zenity && curl -s -L https://raw.githubusercontent.com/floork/mouse-speed/main/speed.sh | bash
